initialization.python:
from rulebricks import Rulebricks

client = Rulebricks(
    api_key="YOUR_API_KEY",
)

resources.name: Rules
resources.description: Operations for executing individual rules in different formats

methods.name: solve
methods.description: Executes a single rule identified by a unique slug. The request and response formats are dynamic, dependent on the rule configuration.

parameters.name: slug
parameters.description: The unique identifier for the resource.

parameters.name: request
parameters.description: Dynamic request payload for rule execution. Structure depends on rule configuration.

returns.description: Rule execution successful. The response structure depends on the rule configuration.

examples.ruby:
result = Rulebricks::Rules.solve(
    slug: 'my-rule-slug',
    name: 'Alice Johnson',
    age: 28,
    email: 'alice.johnson@example.com'
)

methods.name: bulkSolve
methods.description: Executes a particular rule against multiple request data payloads provided in a list.

parameters.name: slug
parameters.description: The unique identifier for the resource.

parameters.name: request
parameters.description: Array of request payloads. Maximum 1000 payloads per request.

returns.description: Bulk rule execution successful. Array of results in the same order as requests.

methods.name: parallelSolve
methods.description: Executes multiple rules or flows in parallel based on a provided mapping of rule/flow slugs to payloads.

parameters.name: request
parameters.description: Object mapping keys to rule/flow payloads. Use $rule or $flow to specify the target.

returns.description: Object mirroring the request structure with each rule/flow's results.

resources.name: Flows
resources.description: Operations for executing flows, which are sequences of rules and external actions

methods.name: execute
methods.description: Execute a flow by its slug.

parameters.name: slug
parameters.description: The unique identifier for the flow.

parameters.name: request
parameters.description: Dynamic request payload for flow execution.

examples.ruby:
result = Rulebricks::Flows.execute(
    slug: 'my-flow-slug',
    name: 'Alice Johnson',
    age: 28
)

resources.name: Contexts
resources.description: Operations for managing and interacting with Contexts (Entities) and their instances

methods.name: getInstance
methods.description: Retrieve the current state of a context instance.

parameters.name: contextSlug
parameters.description: The slug of the context definition.

parameters.name: instanceId
parameters.description: The unique identifier of the instance.

returns.description: The current state of the context instance.

methods.name: submit
methods.description: Submit data to a context instance, creating it if it doesn't exist. May trigger bound rule/flow evaluations.

parameters.name: contextSlug
parameters.description: The slug of the context definition.

parameters.name: instanceId
parameters.description: The unique identifier of the instance.

parameters.name: request
parameters.description: Data to submit to the context instance.

returns.description: Submission successful with any triggered evaluations.

methods.name: deleteInstance
methods.description: Delete a specific context instance and its history.

parameters.name: contextSlug
parameters.description: The slug of the context definition.

parameters.name: instanceId
parameters.description: The unique identifier of the instance.

methods.name: solveRule
methods.description: Execute a specific rule using the context instance's state as input.

parameters.name: contextSlug
parameters.description: The slug of the context definition.

parameters.name: instanceId
parameters.description: The unique identifier of the instance.

parameters.name: ruleSlug
parameters.description: The slug of the rule to execute.

subResources.name: admin
subResources.description: Administrative operations for managing context definitions

methods.name: list
methods.description: Retrieve all contexts (entities) for the authenticated user.

examples.go:
response, err := client.Contexts.Admin.List(
    context.Background())

methods.name: create
methods.description: Create a new context (entity) for the authenticated user.

parameters.name: name
parameters.description: Name of the context.

parameters.name: description
parameters.description: Description of the context.

parameters.name: schema
parameters.description: Array of schema items defining the context fields.

methods.name: delete
methods.description: Delete a specific context and all its instances.

parameters.name: contextId
parameters.description: The UUID of the context to delete.

examples.go:
response, err := client.Contexts.Admin.Delete(
    context.Background(),
    "a1b2c3d4-e5f6-7890-abcd-ef1234567890",
)

resources.name: Assets
resources.description: Administrative operations for managing rules, flows, folders, and usage

methods.name: getUsage
methods.description: Get the rule execution usage of your organization.

examples.go:
response, err := client.Assets.GetUsage(
    context.Background())

methods.name: export
methods.description: Export selected rules, flows, contexts, and values to an RBM manifest file.

parameters.name: rules
parameters.description: Array of rule slugs to export.

parameters.name: flows
parameters.description: Array of flow slugs to export.

parameters.name: contexts
parameters.description: Array of context slugs to export.

parameters.name: values
parameters.description: Array of value keys to export.

methods.name: list
methods.description: List all rules in the organization. Optionally filter by folder.

parameters.name: folder
parameters.description: Filter by folder name or ID.

examples.csharp:
var result = await client.Assets.Rules.ListAsync(
    folder: "Marketing Rules");

methods.name: delete
methods.description: Delete a specific rule by its ID.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The UUID of the rule to delete.

examples.go:
response, err := client.Assets.Rules.Delete(
    context.Background(),
    "2855f8da-2654-4df9-8903-8f797cbfe8eb",
)

methods.name: list
methods.description: Retrieve all rule folders for the authenticated user.

examples.go:
response, err := client.Assets.Folders.List(
    context.Background())

methods.name: upsert
methods.description: Create a new rule folder or update an existing one.

parameters.name: name
parameters.description: Name of the folder.

parameters.name: description
parameters.description: Description of the folder.

examples.python:
client.assets.folders.upsert(
    name="Marketing Rules",
    description="Rules for marketing",
)
examples.csharp:
var result = await client.Assets.Folders.UpsertAsync(
    "Marketing Rules", "Rules for marketing");
examples.java:
var result = client.assets().folders().upsert(
    "Marketing Rules", "Rules for marketing");
examples.ruby:
result = Rulebricks::Assets::Folders.upsert(
    name: 'Marketing Rules',
    description: 'Rules for marketing'
)

resources.name: Decisions
resources.description: Query highly detailed logs of prior rule executions within the last 90 days

methods.name: query
methods.description: Query decision logs with support for the decision data query language, rule/status filters, date ranges, and pagination.

parameters.name: search
parameters.description: Search query using decision data query language.

parameters.name: rules
parameters.description: Comma-separated list of rule names to filter.

parameters.name: statuses
parameters.description: Comma-separated list of status codes (200, 400, 500).

examples.ruby:
result = Rulebricks::Decisions.query(
    search: 'status=200',
    rules: 'Lead Qualification,Pricing',
    statuses: '200,400'
)

resources.name: Users
resources.description: Operations for managing users on your team and their permissions

methods.name: invite
methods.description: Invite a new user to the organization or update role/access for an existing user.

parameters.name: email
parameters.description: Email address of the user.

parameters.name: role
parameters.description: Role to assign (admin, developer, viewer).

parameters.name: accessGroups
parameters.description: Access groups to assign.

methods.name: list
methods.description: List all users in the organization with their details.

examples.go:
response, err := client.Users.List(
    context.Background())

resources.name: Values
resources.description: Operations for managing dynamic values referenced in rules

methods.name: list
methods.description: Retrieve all dynamic values for the authenticated user.

parameters.name: include
parameters.description: Set to 'usage' to include usage information.

methods.name: update
methods.description: Update existing dynamic values or add new ones.

parameters.name: values
parameters.description: Object mapping value names to their values.

parameters.name: accessGroups
parameters.description: Access groups for the values.

methods.name: delete
methods.description: Delete a specific dynamic value by its ID.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The ID of the value to delete.
